stimulusHtml: A second particle, Y, moves along the positive y-axis so that its position at time t is given by y(t)=7t+3 . At any time t,t≥0 , the origin and the positions of the particles X and Y are the vertices of a triangle in the first quadrant. Find the rate of change of the area of the triangle at time t=1 . Show the work that leads to your answer.

features.html: Particle X moves along the positive x-axis so that its position at time t≥0 is given by x(t)=5t3−9t2+7
